basic_info.provider: Hungarian Government (managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and co-ordinated by Tempus Public Foundation)

covered_expenses: Monthly Stipend: HUF 43,700 (~EUR 103) paid for 12 months a year, until the completion of your programme
Accommodation contribution: Free dormitory placement OR a contribution of HUF 40,000/month to accommodation costs
Supplementary medical insurance up to HUF 65,000 (~EUR 160) annually

timeline_info.opening_date: around mid-November 2024, confirmed open by November 27, 2024

eligibility_criteria.age_requirements: Applicants must be 18 years of age by 31 August 2025 at the latest (by 30 August for some sources). For PhD, applicants must be below 45 years of age.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor’s, Master’s, One-Tier Master’s, Non-degree programmes, Doctoral programmes, Postgraduate specialist training courses. Specific fields include Agricultural Sciences, Arts and Humanities, Social Science, Computer Science and Information Technology, Legal Science, Economic Science, Engineering Science, Medical and Health Science, Sport Science, Natural Science, Arts, Art Education, Political Science and Public Governance.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants are eligible to apply only for scholarship types and study fields determined in the educational cooperation programmes between Hungary and the specific Sending Partner. Not all programmes are open.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Outstanding academic performance at previous level of education (minimum GPA of 4.0 ('Good') under Hungary's 5-point grading for scholarship extension)
academic_requirements.required_degree: For PhD, applicants must have a relevant Master's Degree. Scholarships are available for Bachelor's, Master's, One-Tier Master's, and Non-degree programmes.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl: English Proficiency Certificate is required. (Examples of scores mentioned: IELTS 8.0, IELTS 7)

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Passport, Motivation Letter, English Proficiency Certificate, Educational documents. (Further details in the application guide)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants are informed about results by the ministry of education of their country or national scholarship office/agency. Nomination by Sending Partners in February 2025, Final Results Announcement in June 2025.

basic_info.official_name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
basic_info.provider: Government of Ireland, managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA)

funding_info.funding_details: A €10,000 stipend to assist with living costs and a full fee waiver for one year of study.
covered_expenses: Tuition fees (full waiver for one year)
Living costs (stipend of €10,000 for one year)

eligibility_criteria.for_vietnamese: Eligible, as Vietnamese students are non-EU/EEA.
eligibility_criteria.work_requirements: Work experience is considered and contributes to the selection score (40 marks for academic qualifications, achievements, and/or work experience).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA: 3.7 or Minimum 60 out of 100.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD programme (NFQ levels 9 or 10)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Implied, as 'Guidance for Referees' document is available.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: 2025 Call document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, Application Help Document, indicative application form.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection criteria include benefits to the applicant, HEI, Ireland, and home country (15 marks), and academic qualifications, achievements, and/or work experience (40 marks). A 'Selection Process Infographic' is available.

basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship providing financial support for higher education, including tuition fee waiver and a monthly allowance of 900 Euros.

eligibility_criteria.age_requirements: Not over 28 years old by the deadline for Master's Degree/Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs/Italian Language and Culture advanced courses (with exceptions for renewals). Applicants for Doctoral programs must meet the age requirement for doctoral programs (specific age not provided).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate, Master's, PhD, Specialization and Vocational Schools, Higher Education for Fine Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs, research, and Italian Language and Culture advanced/short courses, specifically in cultural, scientific, and technological fields.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Appropriate academic qualification required for the chosen program (e.g., Bachelor's for Master's, Master's for PhD).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl: Knowledge of Italian language at B1 Level is required for Italian-taught courses.

background_and_logistics.official_website: Study in Italy portal; official MAECI website
background_and_logistics.selection_process: A selection committee is appointed by the Italian Embassy in each country, based on academic performance and other personal criteria. The application process for the scholarship and university admission are separate.

funding_info.funding_details: Full Scholarship. Awarded for one academic year and may be renewed annually based on academic performance and compliance with university policies.
covered_expenses: Living Stipend (up to CNY 2000/month or ¥20,000 per year)

timeline_info.application_deadline: May 31, 2025 (Note: Deadlines may vary by institution, e.g., June 20, 2025, or June 30, 2025 for Tianjin Normal University)

eligibility_criteria.age_requirements: Master’s applicants: under 35 years; PhD applicants: under 40 years

academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Master's, or PhD programs. Master’s applicants require a Bachelor’s degree; PhD applicants require a Master’s degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl: Not explicitly required, but English Proficiency Certificates are needed for English-instructed programs. HSK-5 certificates with a minimum score of 180 are required for Chinese-instructed programs. Some sources suggest 'No IELTS' for Tianjin University applications.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Personal Statement, including study or research plan (no less than 800 words for Master and Doctor Degree, no less than 300 words for Bachelor’ degree application)

application_documents: Application Form for Visa to China for Overseas Students (JW202 or JW201)
Physical Examination Report and Test Report (Original Copy)
Passports with a validity period of six months or more
Personal Statement, including study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths etc., written in Chinese or English
HSK-5 certificates with the minimum score of 180 (for Chinese-instructed programs)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Assessment results are publicized for one week and then submitted to Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. Scholarship List is determined by experts organized by Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. Tianjin University announces admission results and sends Admission Notice and Visa Application Form (JW202) to scholarship winners from July 1 to August 31.

basic_info.provider: Flemish Ministry of Education and Training / Government of Flanders

funding_info.funding_details: A grant of €10.020 and a tuition fee waiver per academic year. Duration is one academic year for a 60 ECTS master's programme or two academic years for a 120 ECTS master's programme.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 30 international students across various universities in Flanders. Specific reservations: Japan (3), Mexico (3), Palestine (2), USA (5).

eligibility_criteria.age_requirements: Maximum 30 years for Master's students by the time of application.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Eligible Master's programmes at participating Flemish higher education institutions.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Cannot combine with another scholarship from the Flemish Government. Previous degree cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution cannot apply. Students enrolled in specific, unspecified programmes for 2025-2026 are not eligible.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Previous degree required to enroll for a Master's programme (typically a Bachelor's degree).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two signed letters of recommendation from professors of your (previous) home university.

application_documents: KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (if applying via KU Leuven)
Letter of motivation written in English
Two signed letters of recommendation from professors of your (previous) home university
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must first apply for and be accepted into an eligible Master's programme at a Flemish higher education institution. The host institution then nominates eligible students for the scholarship and initiates the application procedure in the Mobility-Online tool.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Specialization, Masters, and PhD degree programs; prioritizes scientific research, technology, and innovation

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (or equivalent undergraduate-licentiate) for Master's/PhD programs

test_requirements.ielts_toefl: English proficiency required (IELTS 7.0 / TOEFL iBT 95 / Duolingo 130, etc.) unless exempt

basic_info.provider: Thailand International Cooperation Agency (TICA) and Royal Thai Government, in cooperation with Thai Universities/Academic Institutions

funding_info.funding_details: Costs of pre-existing illnesses, dental treatment, brain disease, mental illness, pregnancy, and glasses are NOT covered.

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 22, 2025; January 31, 2025; May 31, 2025 (deadlines vary by announcement source and year/round)
timeline_info.opening_date: June 23 to October 10, 2025 (for the next application round)

eligibility_criteria.for_vietnamese: Open to government officials from developing countries, including some OIC Member States, African countries, Cambodia, Lao PDR, Myanmar, Vietnam. (Conflicting information: some sources state Thailand is an eligible country, others state applicants must not be Thai citizens). An official 'List of Eligible Countries/Territories' exists.
eligibility_criteria.age_requirements: No more than 45 years of age (conflicting: under 50 years of age).
eligibility_criteria.work_requirements: Applicants may need to be government officials or civil servants. Must have a good physical and mental condition and must not be pregnant. Part-time employment is not allowed during the scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master of Arts Program in Tourism and Hospitality Management, Climate Change and Environmental Issues, Agriculture and Food Security, Public Health, Sufficiency Economy (Master's degree programs)
field_restrictions.restrictions: Candidates can choose only 1 course/program. Awardees are required to study full time and not to change the programme topic/study plan.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree (target degree). A prior degree is implied but not explicitly specified (e.g., Bachelor's).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Standard application form (two completed forms required)

funding_info.funding_details: Full financial support for international students from developing countries to pursue bachelor’s, master’s, or doctoral degrees. Fully funded scholarship.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 171 awards distributed worldwide (for a specific year, Malawi secured 13)

eligibility_criteria.age_requirements: Maximum age for Master's Degree Scholarship: 35 years old. Maximum age for Doctorate Degree Scholarship: 40 years old.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Doctoral Degrees. Specific examples include Educational Science Education and Doctoral Physics.
field_restrictions.restrictions: KNB Scholarship at Universitas Brawijaya is provided for Master’s and Doctoral Degree Program only. Each study program has different requirements to apply.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA requirement is 2.75 for bachelor's level and 3.00 for master's.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Applicants for Master's must hold a bachelor degree. Applicants for Doctorate must hold a master degree.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation letter from a supervisor from one of the research universities which is a partner of KNB scholarship. Academic recommendation letter from their respective universities. Recommendation letter from the Indonesian Embassy or the Indonesian Consulate General. Recommendation letter in English or Bahasa from the potential research supervisor in one of the universities.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Scholarship Guide, Recommendation letters (as specified), Scanned degree certificate, Health Certificate (must be signed by a licensed doctor), Documents mentioning education background, achievements, and work experience.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection Results will be announced online via the KNB Scholarship Website and officially through the Indonesian Embassy publication network.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded PhD & Master's research scholarships. Stipend rates vary by university and year, with reported rates including $41,753 p.a. (2025 rate), $36,225 p.a. (2025 rate), $34,752 annually, $33,511 p.a. (full-time), and $28,854 p.a. (2022 rate). Stipends are paid fortnightly and indexed annually. Scholarship duration is typically 3 years for a Doctoral degree (maximum 4 years for Indigenous Priority Scheme) and 2 years for a Research Masters degree.
covered_expenses: Relocation allowance (up to A$2,000 at UniSC)

timeline_info.opening_date: 01/09/2025 (for 2026 RTP stipend scholarships at Federation University)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: High-achieving academic results for prior study, including a bachelor's degree with first class honours or qualifications deemed equivalent by the University. Academic achievement and/or ethic during the most relevant qualification.
academic_requirements.required_degree: PhD/Doctoral Degree, Master's/Research Masters Degree, Higher Degree by Research (HDR), Postgraduate

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Research experience deemed equivalent by the University

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Open to domestic and international students. Must be commencing or enrolled in a higher degree by research. Enrolment as a full-time, on campus student may be required (e.g., at UNE). Applicants must demonstrate willingness and capacity to establish effective supervisory support.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Competitively awarded, based on academic results for prior study and research potential, ranked highest by relevant selection panels.

basic_info.official_name: Heydar Aliyev International Education Grant Program
basic_info.provider: Government of the Republic of Azerbaijan (Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of Science and Education)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded for Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, General Medicine/Residency, and preparatory courses. 100 educational grants provided annually.

eligibility_criteria.age_requirements: Under 25 for Bachelor's and General Medicine; Under 30 for Master's; Under 40 for PhD.
eligibility_criteria.work_requirements: Minimum two years of work experience for Master's applicants.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, General Medicine/Residency, and preparatory courses.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Valid educational background for the chosen level; 16/17/18 years education for PhD; foreign qualifications must be equated.

application_documents: Recent medical certificate (including HIV/AIDS and Hepatitis B/C test results)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: First stage application submission to relevant government authorities of applicant's country (Ministries, Embassies); Review and evaluation by government authorities; Second stage application registration in SIACAS (Study in Azerbaijan Centralized Admission Service); Further review and evaluation; Notification of selected candidates.

basic_info.official_name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic
basic_info.provider: Ministry of Education, Science, Research and Sport of the Slovak Republic

funding_info.funding_details: Scholarship covers up to 1025 € monthly (specifically €1,025.50 for PhD students, or $1,800 for students as per some sources). No application fee is required. Duration of award is two years.

timeline_info.application_deadline: April 30 and October 31 (e.g., April 30, 2025; October 31, 2025 16:00 CET; April 30, 2026)
timeline_info.opening_date: The online application system is opened at least 6 weeks prior to the application deadline.

eligibility_criteria.for_vietnamese: Yes, citizens of Vietnam (and Republic of South Africa, Thailand) can apply.
eligibility_criteria.age_requirements: No upper age limit. Applicants under 18 years old need a hand-signed approval from their legal guardian. However, applicants for bachelor's or master's degrees must be at least 18 years old by September 1st.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Teacher Training and Education Science; Economics; Natural Sciences; Technical Sciences; Medicine; Agriculture Sciences; Social Sciences; Humanities; Arts.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Students, PhD Candidates, University Teachers, Researchers, and Artists

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Applications and required attachments must be submitted in Slovak or English language only.

funding_info.funding_details: Provides full scholarships and partial scholarships. Full Scholarship (bachelor: 20,000 RMB, master: 30,000 RMB, doctor: 40,000 RMB, Senior Scholar/Long-term Language students: 10,000 RMB) per year. Highest at 40,000 yuan (US$5,700) for each recipient.

timeline_info.application_deadline: by the end of February (general pattern); Spring Intake: December 20, 2024; Between January and (incomplete)

eligibility_criteria.age_requirements: undergraduate students should not exceed 30 years old, master's students should not exceed 35 years old. General age limit is under 50 years for bachelor's degree.
eligibility_criteria.work_requirements: Must have three years or more of work experience (for International Chinese Language Teachers program).

academic_requirements.required_degree: undergraduate studies, bachelor's degree, graduate student, master's degree, doctoral degree, Senior Scholar, Long-term language courses

experience_requirements.min_years: three years or more (for International Chinese Language Teachers program)
experience_requirements.accepted_types: work experience (for International Chinese Language Teachers program)

basic_info.provider: Romanian Government / Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA)

covered_expenses: Preparatory year for Romanian language study (if needed)

eligibility_criteria.age_requirements: Under 35 for Bachelor's and Master's studies, under 45 for PhD studies

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields except Medicine, Dental Medicine, and Pharmacy (includes Engineering & Technology, Social)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: At least 7 (on a 10-point scale) or 70% (Good score)
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school diploma (for Bachelor's), Bachelor's degree (for Master's), Master's degree (for PhD); candidates in final year of studies can apply

test_requirements.ielts_toefl: Not always required. For Bachelor's/Master's, programs are in Romanian (preparatory year granted if needed). For PhD, foreign language programs may require proficiency proof (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, DELF, CEFR), but other proofs of English are accepted.

application_documents: Certificate proving final year of studies and graduation exam (if applicable)
Certificate of Romanian language proficiency (level B1 or equivalent) or other language certificates (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, DELF, CEFR) for non-Romanian programs
Authorized translation into English, French, Spanish or Romanian for documents, if applicable
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Online application through Study in Romania platform; selection stages may include document reviews, interviews, or entrance exams. Result Announcement: June 30, 2025.

basic_info.official_name: Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships covering both tuition fees and living expenses. Regular payments of SEK12 thousand to cover living expenses.

timeline_info.opening_date: 9-25 February 2026 (application portal open for two weeks)

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Large number of master’s programmes at Swedish Universities; must apply for an eligible master's programme.
field_restrictions.restrictions: No quotas for specific countries, fields of study, or Swedish universities. However, only specific master's programmes are eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Typically 3.0 GPA for Master's, but 3.5 average usually for scholarship consideration.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Demonstrated employment from a maximum of three organisations/companies, including full-time.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl: IELTS (Academic): Minimum overall score of 6.5, no section below 5.5. TOEFL iBT: Minimum score of 90.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: SI Scholarship application documents are published on the official page (specific list not provided).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: After university admissions results (26 March 2026), SI evaluates eligible applications. The scholarship is highly competitive.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Undergraduate: 280 (Embassy Track: 150 (General: 82, Overseas Koreans: 7, R-GKS: 61), University Track: 130); Graduate: 600. Note: another source mentions 367 for Undergraduate.

eligibility_criteria.age_requirements: Under 40 years of age (born after September 1, 1985) (for 2025 GKS-G, Graduate program)

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields of study offered by participating universities

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 80% or higher on a 100-point scale or be ranked in the top 20% of your class. CGPA requirements: 2.64/4.0; 2.80/4.3; 2.91/4.5; 3.23/5.0. (for 2025 GKS-G, Graduate program)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Employment or Working Experience (e.g., faculty members of the International Organization partner university), family business

additional_requirements.reference_letters: One letter of Recommendation (Form 5) must be signed and sealed by one's recommender

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Applicant Form (Form 1), Personal Statement (Form 2), Study Plan (Form 3), Research Proposal (Form 4) (only for Research Program applicants), One letter of Recommendation (Form 5), Official graduation certificate (or diploma), Final academic transcript, Certificates of Employment or Working Experience (optional), Other documents, GPA conversion table
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants may apply to only one track (General or R-GKS). Embassy Track applicants choose up to THREE different universities (must apply to at least one Type B). R-GKS Embassy Track applicants choose up to TWO Type B universities. Applications must be submitted online via Study in Korea website. One set of original documents + Three sets of additional simple photocopies.
